body:
### Describe the bug

In order to map function and class names to their short forms, the API headers do some fairly drastic `#define` changes

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
cdef api f():
    pass

ctypedef api class A1 [
     type A1_Type,
     object A1Object
     ]:
     pass
```

compile that with cythonize generates the code:

```
static PyTypeObject *__pyx_ptype_13someabimodule_A1 = 0;
#define A1_Type (*__pyx_ptype_13someabimodule_A1)

static PyObject *(*__pyx_api_f_13someabimodule_f)(void) = 0;
#define f __pyx_api_f_13someabimodule_f
```

I'm interested in the lines `#define A1_Type` and `#define f`.

These will silently rename things like accessing unrelated struct attributes: `some_struct.f`

### Expected behaviour

It's not completely obvious what to do about that. `f` could probably be made a short inline function instead. `A1_Type` is less obvious if there's a good solution.

### OS

_No response_

### Python version

_No response_

### Cython version

current master (56b30f2e2cbf964eb5b1d1ea4448963d58301035), probably 0.29.x too

### Additional context

This may be a fairly hypothetical problem that people are able to work around. I noticed it while investigating something else rather than hit it as a bug.
title: [BUG] The "api" headers do some fairly drastic defines
